Class GuessEvaluation

java.lang.Object
org.fdu.GuessEvaluation
public class GuessEvaluation extends Object
Evaluates the users guess against the secret word (selected from the dictionary) Defines the colors indicating the "correctness" of each character in the user's guess Tracks the number of guesses by the user, initialized by constructor, incremented by evaluater method to check if user has used all of the allowable guesses class assumes the users guess has been validated prior to calling here ToDo - throw exception if the userGuess and/or secretWord are not valid Or at the very least, return all Gray

    Enum defining the valid colors for guess evaluation

  • Method Details

    • evaluateGuess

      public GuessEvaluation.Result[] evaluateGuess(String userGuess, String secretWord)
      Evaluate the users guess Returns an array (size of userGuess, should be equal to WORD_LENGTH) If arguments valid (expecting call to validate prior), will increment user turn count Does not check if game is won (separate method) Errors: if the userGuess and/or secretWord are not valid (isWordValid()) return all GRAY ToDo: throw an exception instead - since it is expected userGuess is validated prior to calling
      Parameters:
      userGuess - - string containing the user guess, validate prior to calling
      secretWord - - string with dictionary word, assumed valid
      Returns:
      - array of Result enums (colors), the size of the userGuess

    • isUserOutOfGuesses

      public boolean isUserOutOfGuesses()
      check if user has used all of their guesses
      Returns:
      - true - out of guesses

    • isGuessCorrect

      public boolean isGuessCorrect(String userGuess, String secretWord)
